intro: Triplasiella, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to Africa and South America. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. They produce small, yellow composite flowers that bloom in the spring. Triplasiella species are often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
